events.title: Battle of Stamford Bridge
events.description: King Harold Godwinson of England defeated the invading Norwegian forces led by King Harald Hardrada, ending the Viking Age invasions of England.
events.significance: Marked the end of Viking invasions in England and paved the way for the Norman Conquest shortly thereafter.

events.title: Death of Explorer Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo
events.description: Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo, the first European to explore the west coast of present-day United States, died after an expedition in California.
events.significance: His explorations led to early European knowledge of the West Coast of North America.

events.title: Alexander Fleming Discovers Penicillin
events.description: Scottish bacteriologist Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin, the world's first widely effective antibiotic, by observing mold killing bacteria.
events.significance: Revolutionized medicine and led to the development of antibiotics, saving millions of lives.

events.title: Pope John Paul I Dies
events.description: Pope John Paul I died suddenly after only 33 days as pope, one of the shortest papacies in history.
events.significance: His death led to the election of Pope John Paul II, one of the most influential popes of the 20th century.

events.title: The Dayton Peace Agreement is initialed
events.description: The leaders of Bosnia, Croatia, and Serbia initialed the Dayton Peace Agreement to end the Bosnian War.
events.significance: Ended a brutal conflict in the Balkans and laid the foundation for peace and reconstruction.
